macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Hits $3T with Mixed Trading; BTC at $88,644
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market cap reached $3 trillion, up 0.58% in the last 24 hours, with Bitcoin trading at $88,644 (+0.35%) between $87,796 and $88,796. Top outperformers include ASR (+37%), ACT (+32%), and VTHO (+22%).

items.title: SEC's 2025 Policy Shift Eases Crypto Regulations, Dismisses Key Lawsuits
items.summary: Under Trump-era leadership, the SEC reclassified digital assets, narrowing focus to tokenized securities, dismissed lawsuits against Coinbase, Binance, and Ripple, boosting market confidence and enabling DeFi growth.

items.title: Maple Finance CEO Declares 'DeFi is Dead' as Onchain Markets Take Over
items.summary: Maple Finance CEO Sid Powell states DeFi is no longer a separate category, predicting all capital market activity will settle on blockchains, swallowing traditional Wall Street.

items.title: Citigroup Updates Outlook on Digital Asset Stocks Amid Volatility
items.summary: Citigroup released an updated outlook on digital asset stocks in response to ongoing market volatility, highlighting key trends in the sector.

items.title: Cynthia Lummis to Step Down After Crypto Industry Contributions
items.summary: Senator Cynthia Lummis announced she will step down, recognized for her significant contributions to advancing the cryptocurrency industry.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Anthropic Releases Bloom: Open-Source Agentic Framework for AI Behavioral Evaluations
items.summary: Anthropic has launched Bloom, an open-source framework that automates behavioral evaluations for frontier AI models by generating targeted scenarios to measure misaligned behaviors. It addresses scalability issues in safety testing, outperforming baselines on misaligned model organisms.

items.title: New CNN-Based AI Model Optimizes Information Systems with 96.2% Accuracy
items.summary: Researchers propose a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) decision support model for information system optimization, achieving 96.2% state recognition accuracy, 135.5ms response time, and reducing scheduling failures by 63.9% on Azure and Google datasets.

items.title: RNACOREX: Open-Source AI Tool Uncovers Hidden Genetic Networks in Cancer
items.summary: Spanish researchers release RNACOREX, an explainable AI tool that maps miRNA-mRNA interactions in tumors, predicting survival as accurately as black-box models across 13 cancers while providing interpretable results.

items.title: QCon AI NY 2025: Designing Reliable AI Platforms with Agentic Systems
items.summary: Aaron Erickson discusses engineering agentic AI as a reliability challenge, combining probabilistic models with deterministic boundaries for operational systems, emphasizing tool selection and certainty-discovery splits.

items.title: AI Roadmap for 2026: Hybrid Models and Multitasking Agents from Recent Research
items.summary: Christopher Penn outlines 2026 AI trends based on 2025 academic papers, highlighting shifts from dense models to hybrid architectures, Google's multitasking AI labs, and methods to predict tech shifts via open-source data.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Wuthering Waves version 3.0 'We Who See The Stars' announced for Dec. 25
items.summary: Kuro Games announced a major 3.0 update for free‑to‑play action RPG Wuthering Waves titled 'We Who See The Stars', releasing on PC, PS5, iOS and Android on December 25; the studio also noted multiple awards the game received in 2025 and is gifting players in‑game currency and merchandise news tied to the update.[1]

items.title: Epic Games Store reveals December 21 free game: 'Sorry We're Closed'
items.summary: Epic Games Store's free holiday giveaway for December 21 was revealed as the indie title 'Sorry We're Closed' as part of the storefront's 2025 holiday season promotions.[5]

items.title: Epic/free game promotions and holiday giveaways continue across stores
items.summary: The Epic Games Store continued its 2025 holiday giveaway program with a new free title revealed for December 21, marking the fifth entry in the storefront's seasonal giveaway lineup.[5]

items.title: GPC Video Chart Show covers week’s biggest gaming moments
items.summary: Gentlemen's Pixel Club uploaded its Dec. 21 GPC Video Chart Show episode summarizing major gaming moments, top charts and highlights from the week in an episodic video roundup.[2]

items.title: DesignerDave launches GameDev News episode covering AI, layoffs and industry topics
items.summary: YouTuber DesignerDave published a GameDev News episode (Dec. 20/21) that discusses AI in development, layoffs and other industry developments in a month‑end roundup format.[4]

items.title: Roundup: freebies, sales and charity bundles (Dec. 21)
items.summary: A running community roundup cataloged current sales, freebies and charity bundles for December 21, highlighting promotions tied to the Fallout franchise and creative software bundles for content creators.[3]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
